data.title: Rachel Portman
data.meta_description:
Rachel Portman. Composer: Alles, was wir geben mussten. Rachel Portman, Composer

British composer Rachel Portman became the first female composer to win an Academy Award, which she received for the score of Emma. She was also the first female composer to win a Primetime Emmy Award, which she received for the film, Bessie. She has received two further Academy Nominations for The Cider House Rules and Chocolat, which also earned her...
data.text:
First female composer to win an Oscar and an Emmy for music score.

Rachel Portman has composed an opera, "The Little Prince", based on the Antoine de Saint-Exupéry story. The world premier is being given by Houston Grand Opera starting 31 May 2003.

She was awarded the OBE (Officer of the Order of the British Empire) in the 2010 Queen's New Years Honours List for her services to the film industry.

Has three daughters with her husband Uberto Pasolini - Anna Pasolini (b.1995), Giulia Pasolini (b.1998) and Niky Pasolini.

Rachel Portman became the first female composer to win an Academy Award, which she received for the score of Jane Austens Emma (1996).

Rachel was appointed Officer of the Order of the British Empire (OBE) in 2010 and is an honorary fellow of Worcester College, Oxford.

She has received two further Academy Nominations for Gottes Werk und Teufels Beitrag (1999) and Chocolat... ein kleiner Biss genügt! (2000), which also earned her a Golden Globe Nomination.

She was also the first female composer to win a Primetime Emmy Award, which she received for the film, Bessie (2015).
